title: What are some great words of wisdom for 2020-2021? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi, a deep, but potent question. Thank you for the request to answer. First? It truly depends on ‘your own character’ BOOM . . . Do you just sort of want to ‘cruise’ along with an OK life with as few ‘speed bumps’ as possible? (and nothing wrong with that) . . . but/or? Do you want a Life full of ‘Great’ . . . The majority truly are content with an O.K. life that sometimes bumps into a ‘Wow’ day . . . but? The ‘great life’ seeker (who actually are a minority) can not, and just won’t settle for less than the ‘greater’ venture. The O.K. seekers will never ‘chase’ words of wisdom’ for more that ‘just a bit’. If you are looking for a ‘truly fulfilled’ life . . . digest these words. One day? you will cease to live. May be in 70 years, may be next year, or next month, or even tomorrow . . . you don’t know, I don’t know. The most simple words of wisdom?  Seize the day. Where did that come from? Hamashiach . . . Repent (Quit thinking the old way) Look inside YOU . . . follow the one who’s chair (throne) is ‘INSIDE YOU’. Ash-can the religious, and social Drama Queen B.S. Follow your/our Creator (s) I won’t go any deeper than that . . . it would make me look like a teacher, and or a preacher (I have little room in my life for either) Grasp ‘Understanding’ and quit ‘learn’n plastic knowledge. (it will pollute your earth) Does this? help to answer your question? Hey, thanks again for the request . . . and have a Great Day. from ‘Cubby’

“What are some great words of wisdom for 2020–2021?” I have two thoughts I would like to share here. Do with them what you like. First, those who search for answers to questions they ask received the answer to that question ten thousand times before they asked it. We ignore these answers because the answer doesn’t seem to fit, or we don’t like what we have to do (see the myth of Jonah). It may sound silly, but consider asking yourself “Do I know the answer to this question?” before you seek advice on your career, dating life, existential questions, etc. Second, these are those who equate general knowledge with wisdom. This perceived wisdom leads to overconfidence, and overconfident people are prone to standing in the way of the good of all. When taking a stance of any kind, take the time to ask yourself “What am I standing in the way of?” before you prevent something real good from happening. Thanks for listening, and I hope this helps.
